function_call.name: get_risks
function_call.arguments: {"risks":[{"Description":"Potential underreporting of COVID-19 cases due to limited testing of individuals with severe symptoms.","Impact":"Inaccurate representation of the true number of infected individuals in a community.","Mitigation":"Increase testing capacity and implement broader testing criteria to capture asymptomatic and mildly symptomatic cases.","Technologies":"Molecular testing technologies for the detection and quantification of SARS-CoV-2 RNA in wastewater.","People":"Community members at risk of being undetected and untreated for COVID-19.","Owner":"Health authorities and government stakeholders."},{"Description":"Reliance on sewage surveillance as a sole early warning system for (re-)emergence of COVID-19 in cities.","Impact":"Potential delay in response to (re-)emergence of COVID-19 if sewage surveillance is not supplemented with other surveillance methods.","Mitigation":"Integrate sewage surveillance with clinical surveillance and other early warning systems for comprehensive monitoring of COVID-19 (re-)emergence.","Technologies":"Sewage surveillance technology for detection of SARS-CoV-2 RNA in wastewater.","People":"Public health authorities, emergency response agencies, and city governments at risk of delayed response to (re-)emergence of COVID-19.","Owner":"Public health authorities and city governments."},{"Description":"Detection of SARS-CoV-2 RNA in domestic wastewater suggesting circulation of COVID-19 in communities.","Impact":"Indication of potential widespread transmission of COVID-19 in the community.","Mitigation":"Utilize the data to implement targeted public health interventions and increase testing and surveillance efforts in the affected communities.","Technologies":"Molecular testing technologies for the detection and quantification of SARS-CoV-2 RNA in wastewater.","People":"Community members at risk of widespread transmission of COVID-19.","Owner":"Public health authorities and government stakeholders."}]}
